Key Match Events: Francisco Lindor hit a go-ahead grand slam in the sixth inning
Edwin Diaz struck out Kyle Schwarber for the final out
Post-Match Reflections: Owner Steve Cohen said the $341 million contract given to Francisco Lindor was money well spent
Manager Carlos Mendoza praised the team and fan base
Lindor expressed desire to win the World Series and be remembered as a team that comes every 10 years and eats for free
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets reached the NLCS for the first time in 16 seasons at Citi Field
The game was a first-class organization effort
The Phillies were the NL East champions but won only one playoff game
The Mets needed a victory on the final day of the regular season to reach the playoffs
The Mets had two victories in three games to win the NL Wild Card Series in Milwaukee
